intro: Chionolaena, commonly known as silverleaf groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Africa and the Americas. These plants are typically herbaceous, with hairy, silver-gray foliage that gives them their common name. They produce small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or white in color. Chionolaena species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils.
